data.title: Luis Suárez de Lezo new president of the Royal Academy of Gastronomy
data.text:
Today, the Plenary Session of the Royal Academy of Gastronomy has unanimously chosen the candidacy chaired by Academician Luis Suárez de Lezo, who has been named the new President of the institution, to lead a new Board of Directors made up of “well-accredited professionals” who will address this stage with the aim of consolidating the role of Spanish gastronomy as an “indisputable, transformative, innovative and sustainable economic engine” and, to the Royal Academy as “the leading reference and interlocutor of gastronomy”.

In short, Suárez de Lezo has assured, “we will be the voice of Spanish gastronomy inside and outside our country and a symbol of Spanish Cultural Heritage.”

In recent years, gastronomy has acquired a fundamental role as a social and cultural integrator, as an asset in nutritional and geopolitical fields, and is a key activity when it comes to promoting environmental awareness and the principles of sustainable development in society. A fact accentuated by the new generations. The Royal Academy of Gastronomy aims to respond to this new reality with an updated, participatory and wide-ranging approach.

The Board will be made up, in addition to the President, of eleven very committed professionals, with proven track records in different and varied work fields and who are eager to put all their experience at the service of gastronomy in this new stage.

Luis Suárez de Lezo (Madrid, 1974) is an enthusiast of diverse, accessible, sustainable and quality gastronomy. He is fascinated by Spanish products, for their variety and high level and maintains a close relationship with chefs, producers, markets and companies related to Spanish gastronomy, with an intense agenda that includes more than 250 visits to restaurants a year, both in Spain like abroad.

This hobby grew over time and led him to become the President of the Madrid Academy of Gastronomy in the last 7 years, a stage in which he created the Gastronomy Awards of the Community of Madrid, an event that has established itself as an gastronomic reference in the city and that promoted the Madrid gastronomic sector from a social, cultural, economic and sustainability point of view.

In his professional role, he has directed the Alcobendas Business Association (Madrid) for years. He is a specialist in the management of non-profit organizations and defense of interests, experience and knowledge that are very suitable to lead an institution like the Royal Academy of Gastronomy.

For Suárez de Lezo, gastronomy has a protest component, recovering traditions, supporting the work of producers and artisans, promoting tourism and innovating and taking risks. It is in the very essence of society, it constitutes a great economic asset and a vector of equality and sustainability and is, therefore, a window that shows us our heritage and builds bridges between its past, present and future.

The new Board of Directors It is made up of professionals with outstanding careers, with extensive knowledge of the gastronomic universe, who live and actively participate in current gastronomic events in our country.

Angel Parada. Vice president. (Madrid, 1959)

He has an extensive professional career of more than 30 years dedicated to the world of communication as an entrepreneur and independent consultant, with special interest in the role of new technologies in the fields of marketing strategy and advertising.

Miguel Loya. General secretary (Avilés, 1973)

Graduate in Law and Diploma in Business Management. He is a partner at the J & A Garrigues Firm and one of the most recognized experts in the legal regime and operation of Public Law Corporations.

Rosa Vañó. Treasurer (Madrid, 1963)

Graduated in Economics and Business Sciences from the Complutense University of Madrid, she has extensive experience in various multinationals in different sectors. She is the founder and owner of Castillo de Canena.

Juan Manuel Bellver. Vocal (Madrid, 1965)

Journalist specialized in gastronomy, culture and lifestyle of Spain with more than 30 years of profession. Since 2014 he has been Director of Lavinia Spain, a company specialized in the premium wine trade.

Borja Beneyto. Vocal (Madrid, 1978)

After working for 20 years as a marketing consultant for international corporations, he is a mentor, consultant and investor in companies in the agri-food industry, tourism and restaurants. Co-founder and partner of Brandelicious, he writes for the main national and international gastronomic publications.

Miguel Garrido. Vocal. (Madrid, 1960)

President of CEIM Madrid Business Confederation-CEOE since 2019, he is a businessman, founder of Viajes ECO. He has been Vice Minister of Employment, Economy and Technological Innovation, Minister of the Environment and President of Canal de Isabel II.

Lluch spoon. Vocal. (Valencia, 1965)

With an extensive career dedicated to public relations in the field of gastronomy, a businesswoman, she is co-founder of Begoístas, a healthy eating project. She is an ambassador for CONHOSTUR and L'Exqusit Mediterrani.

Alfonso Rodés. Vocal (Barcelona, ​​1961)

President of Havas Group since 2016. Previously he accumulated more than 15 years of experience in the banking industry. Additionally, he serves on the Board of a variety of different companies, foundations and non-governmental organizations.

Sesé San Martín. Vocal. (Madrid, 1965)

Graduate in Information Sciences from the Complutense University of Madrid. She is the founding partner and director of the TELVA Cooking School. She is an expert in food and nutrition and has a Master in educational support.

José María Sanz-Magallón. Vocal. (San Sebastian, 1963)

Graduate in Law and MBA from the Business Institute. For more than 30 years he worked for multinationals such as American Express and Telefónica in Madrid, London and New York. He is currently an entrepreneur in the agri-food sector.
